text: The Peace of Paris (1814) was a peace accord that ended the war between France and the Sixth Coalition (Austria, Prussia, Russia, the United Kingdom, Sweden, Spain and a number of German states). Napoleon was defeated and driven into exile on Elba. The peace restored the Burbons in France and defined most of the country's borders. Category:Napoleonic Wars Category:1810s treaties Category:19th century in Sweden Category:1810s in the United Kingdom
title: Peace of Paris (1814)
